description: Cute, cozy little bar in one of my favorite San Francisco neighborhoods.  Cool, to-the-point bartenders. It's dog friendly. The drinks are cheap. What's not to like? I planned to catch up with an old friend and Fireside proved to the perfect pick. It's got a lively feel to it, but still not too loud or distracting. It's an easy spot for the locals but tourists are welcome too. Grown-up crowd and chill vibes.
author: Helina G.

description:
My girlfriend and I closed out another bar, but wanted one more round of drinks. Stumbled into Fireside Bar on Friday, May 4rd around 12:45am. There were a fair amount of people here, but we still managed to find two seats at the bar.

We were drinking Jameson at the other spot, so decided to do the same here. Got two pours of Jameson neat. One with a ginger back for my gf and a water for me. The pours here were a good size compared to the last bar. (They served their Jameson in a shot glass.) Not sure how much each drink was, but the total charged on my credit card with tax and tip was $17, so I'm guessing both drinks were $14?

The atmosphere here was very lively, so we were able to have a conversation with the roommate via video chat. (My gf and him haven't seen each other in forever.) I know, we were that annoying pair talking on our phone the whole time. But no one gave us any sh!t which I appreciated. Everyone was just doing their own thing. Though I'm sure there were some people silently judging us. Good thing the bar was noisy.

Fun place to close out Thursday night. It had been a while since I saw my gf, so we had a great time catching up. So glad Fireside allowed us to have one more round before the night ended.
author: Elena N.

description: Met a super cute boy named Alex here. He's originally from I'm Dallas. Nothing came out of it but whatever! It was flattering when he sort of asked me for my number.
author: Xuan C.

description:
Best bartender ever!! Ask for Eric!! Make any drink you need!!
Friendly service and quick and speaks Chinese too!!
author: Bobby W.

description:
What a chill bar. 

Friendly staff, great decor, lots of drinks. 

What's not to like.

It's a regulars spot, but you can bring food into this bar. Thats great because there is a ton of food around. (Just ask the staff first).

It was great enjoying a sandwich while i drank a strawberry lime cider. Never have i seen that before, and after a fellow patron added some bitters to my drink... it became amazing. (Turns out he was a bartender, hehe)

What a chill bar.
author: Dave B.

description:
One bartender, dive bar quality drinks, nice ambiance though! 
This is the Paloma w "salted room" one of their specialty drinks. I could have made this at home and she forgot the salted rim ;)
author: Jena L.

description:
Dogs. Dogs dogs dogs.

Dogs love this place, so you should too. This place is so cozy, with friendly staff and inner sunset locals. The drinks are pretty standard with decent beer on tap. It's also amazingly temperature controlled. Like they leave their saloon door thing open throughout the night but it's still so warm inside.

Dogs. Dogs dogs dogs.
author: Stephanie K.

description: Great spot. Friendly service and conversation. Ran into this lady named Carol causing a scene the last time I was here. The bartender calmly handled the situation. Think his name was Holt. What a lovely guy.
author: Lauren G.

description:
Ideal place for cocktails and drinks.  The bartender was VERY largess in serving our drinks with alcohol.   He would preface a warning before serving us.  He asked me twice if I was driving home and then told me I was going to be drunk.  I said, "I have had a long island iced tea before".  I didnt know if it were because he thought I had never had a drink before or if this place was distinguished.  However, after leaving there I am certain it was because he knew they are very potent.   Very cool atmosphere with two couches perpendicular to the fireplace.  Prices were reasonable.  People were bringing in there own food.  We came hungry and ate next door after finishing our drinks.  We only had one drink.  It was that good. 

-For what you pay: good drinks. High ABV
-ambience: nice fireside couches
-service: good, friendly
-taste: average.
author: Rob C.

description: This bar is just the cutest and most cozy paradise in the middle of bustling SF. Came here on a date because we couldn't get into the Cal Academy of Sciences. It was the perfect alternative though! Got the Moscow mule and it was delicious!
author: Cindy B.

description: Im here now. A guy had a coaster over his beer on the bar, indicating someone was coming back, but it was between two seats. My boyfriend and i took two stools, just to order a drink. There was a stool left on our right for the person who had left the coaster on their beer. The bartender, a slim older woman with black hair, walked over to us, rudely said "someone is sitting there," and walked away. The guy came back from the bathroom and gladly took the stool to the right of me. He didn't care. But I asked my boyfriend to get me a drink and moved to a seat away from the bar because she made me so uncomfortable. Btw, this is the first yelp review I have written in about 7 or 8 years. That's how rude this woman was. I am never coming back here and going to tell all my friends who live in this neighborhood to avoid it!
author: rachel b.

description:
BEST MARGARITA EVER!!! Great place to hangout and relax! Amazing crowd and an even amazing bartender!

P.S: writing this review in the bar!
author: Mili T.

description:
They are so delicious, fast and courteous! I got the bouillabaisse and husband got the rib eye. Everything was cooked perfectly! Bouillabaisse can be difficult to get right (usually the seafood
 is rubbery). Cocktails were well crafted. They happened to be having negroni festival/appreciation while we were there and had a long list of specialized unique twists on the classic cocktail. They had the bartenders create their own versions people choose from. I got some grapefruit one, it was so good. Side note, drinks are strong. Finally a place in Portland that does stiff you on the stiffness :)
author: Marie E.

description: A lovely little bar on one of the slower blocks of Irving. The eponymous fire is in the wall opposite the bar, and gives off a gorgeous red glow, which is a stroke of design brilliance. My date and I sat at the bar by the window and spent a few hours people watching, and I think we were both glad our bartender had a heavy wrist. Tread lightly with a Fireside screwdriver, they pack a wallop.
author: Ramón M.

description: Nice bar, good drinks, good prices, and great music. The only issue I had was that it was difficult to get the bartender's attention, and it wasn't even that busy.
author: Amanda S.

description: Good drinks see Erick he's always takes care of us when we go in and you can select your own music here and the place is always clean plus you can bring your dog in
author: Mikaela V.

description: Cute little bar in the middle of Irving, has nice ambiance, great bartenders and a lovely fireplace with fire to go along with your drink. You can find the regulars playing dice here and the newcomers chatting amongst. I dig the vibe here.
author: Alex G.

description: HOLT the bartender is RUDE & disrespectful. I went a while back and he kept trying to pick an argument with me.  Never came back after and I also told every one I know to now go.
author: Carol G.

description:
I usually enjoy having a few drinks here when visiting my friend who lives in the neighborhood.

Love the mix of patrons here. The environment is unpretentious, with the bartenders that create this casual yet friendly feeling. Not broverdosed, tech, dive, bousiour, hipster, it is a place of comfort.

I love Lisa (one of the bartender) since unlike other bars with bartenders that are trying to take care of as many orders possible, she is on top of things while being an individual that you can simply talk to and feel like you are not just another person simply ordering a drink. Alas, I do not know the other bartender's name, but he is a no BS individual that makes this establishment great as well. I remember coming here a few hours before my birthday, with my friend trying to argue that it is actually my bday since I was born in the East Coast, he tilted his head back for a moment, then lined up 3 shots for all of us to toast on behalf of my bday.

For a great and casual time, Fireside is a wonderful bar that is managed by great people. Even though I don't live anywhere close, this place is close to my heart because of the people managing it, always providing a welcoming and community feel that other venues lack.
author: William Y.

description: Cold beer. Decent shots. Local sports. Cranky bartenders. And an actual fireplace. What more could you want?
author: Jon L.

description:
I have a little crush on Irving Street.  It's not just the plethora of well-priced eating and drinking establishments but the whole package that comes with it:  it feels like a real community of normal working people going about their lives, consuming food and knocking back a few.  In fact, it feels like the opposite of where the young tech community goes to spend their riches and I mean that in the best way possible.

Last time I drank on Irving I learned that the Blackthorn allows dogs in before 7 p.m.  It was after 7 p.m. and my dog needed a drink so I sidled up to inquire whether she could come in and sit on the back patio.  Rules are rules though so the answer was no, prompting my next question:  Do you know anyplace that does allow dogs?

Enter Fireside Bar where dogs are welcome though not atop the bar or tables.

Fireside is less of a packed scene than Blackthorn.  It's smaller and a bit trashier.  There is a fireplace but I can't say it was the centerpiece of the place.  That title seemed to be reserved for the big screen displaying the Warriors playoff game 3 and several smaller screens displaying the same.  

If you watched the game you know that it was one for the ages and it may have contributed to the good feeling I left the Fireside with.  Or that good feeling might've been a result of all the nice regulars I met as a result of having my dog with me.  Then again, perhaps it was the fact that the folks beside me introduced themselves to me, not my dog, and we wound up having a really nice conversation.  All of this and then it was time to go. 

The tab for 1 Guinness, 1 Sierra Nevada, and 2 vodka cocktails was $17.  $17, that was not a typo.  Now you know all you really need to know about Fireside Bar.
author: Tracey A.

description: Aside from having to wait quite a while to order our drinks, the drinks once made were good. There was only one bartender and this was a Thursday night...so I can totally understand the need to wait for our drinks. I had the cocktail with gin, Saint Germaine and muddled cucumbers...very refreshing for the end of a sunny day in SF. The noise level was low enough where we could talk and high enough to create a happening din. I think we would return if we were in the neighborhood.
author: Gillian Dawson Y.

description:
Me: "Pssss, look at 12 o'clock on the couch."
Friend: "Hmmm, not bad."

Me: "Look at those big hazel eyes, that teddy bear face, that smile, and those curls."
Friend: "Curls? Gurl, you drunk already?! That guy has spiky hair!"

Me: "Not him...I'm talking about his adorably cute labradoodle!"

Yah, so I love dogs more than hoomans, and if you do too, Fireside Bar is the bar for you! 

Cute hoomans? Pshhh. Cute dogs for the win! 

OTHER NOTES:
*Stating the obvious but lots of dogs and dog lovers at Fireside Bar. Tater Tot received lots of love here. One turnt up guy laid on the ground outside to cuddle/play with him. 
*Friendly staff. The older gentleman in his 70s kept asking if I was going to return. I told him, "Of course, Tater Tot and I will return. He replied, "I hope it's to see me." Cute. Lol!
*Cheap drinks. Cc's accepted.
*They don't serve food but you can bring outside food in. 
*Non-pretentious, mixed crowd. Saw a handful of couples PDAing in the two top on a Saturday night. One lady was kissing her dude all over his neck. Awkward. 
*Homey meets dive bar vibe with center fireplace. 
*Internet juke box. Cc's accepted.
*One negative: it's super loud when it's crowded and the music is bumping. Not good for furbabies since they have sensitive hearing. Best to bring your furbaby on the weekdays or early on the weekends.
*Restrooms are decently clean.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Chill and divey. The music wasn't great but the bartender made my custom drink really well and strong.
author: Ahmed H.

description:
He took away my virginity. My bar virginity that is. His name was Fireside bar. 

My Yelp friend, Ben T., and our other friend, Kevin S. KIDNAPPED me from my kitchen as I was cooking Bak Choy! (yeaaaa, I tend to be kidnapped a lot by my friends... x.x)

It was literally my first time at an actual bar! Yes, I am a noob and I just turned 21. Dont judge me. Being that it was my first time, this bar was very welcoming and cozy. I felt like it was just a chill night at home with friends sippin on drinks made by a friendly and talented bartender. It was very classy yet homey and relaxing all at the same time. 

Keeping in mind that I'm freshly 21, my tolerance for alcohol is low, so i needed a drink that was super fruity and tasted nothing like alcohol. I got exactly that here! (no idea what they were sorry.. but I have pictures)

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fireside-bar-san-francisco?select=BbnhJDN9F_xepY5jZuRiLQ#BbnhJDN9F_xepY5jZuRiLQ
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fireside-bar-san-francisco?select=BbnhJDN9F_xepY5jZuRiLQ#shiEUDV8JXuNUVT90EMnGA

Both were super tasty and non-alcohol like. Just the way I enjoy my drinks.  I know I know. Dishonor on my family, dishonor on my ancestors, dishonor on my cow..... I'm a wuss. X[ Heard it all... *sigh*

Anyways... I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this bar and the drinks here. The environment was perfect for a chill night with friends! Street parking was easy too on a Monday night!
author: Chena N.

description:
Hidden (and dog-friendly) gem in the Inner Sunset!

+ Drinks are stiff and bartenders are not in the mood to banter. 
+ Three TVs plus one big projector showing football games. 
+A mean hot toddy in the winter. 
+ Jukebox for when you want to dance somewhere dark and cozy on a weekday night 
+ No judgement regardless of clothing, dog companion, or beverage choice
author: Lauren C.

description:
I came here after a night out with a friend and we were looking for a place to drink. We stumble upon this place and I must say, this place is pretty nice! Small and cozy, this bar seems laid back and nice to bring a small group of people. 

They have this fireplace at the center of the bar which is cool because it feels at home, especially with the couches around it. We wanted to talk comfortably so we were in the back. I ordered an old fashioned and she ordered a lemon drop. Both were good and proceeded to take some more drinks. After a shot of tequila with lime, I suggested we should get a scooby snack. The bartender didn't know of the shot and did some "research" (aka: Youtube) on it. I was pretty impressed on how spot on he made the drink and my friend loved it. So much so, she asked the bartender for another one and gave him a big tip. 

Overall, a great place to take someone out, have a drink, and have a casual conversation. Given the fireplace at the center, this could also be a more intimate place to take someone to as well. Great bartender, and from I read in other reviews, dog friendly, which is a plus for me. I would definitely come back to this place the next time I'm in the area.
author: Tito G.

description: This is a cool neighborhood spot.  Very chill, laid back ambiance and vibe in here.  They got a cool fireplace inside.  The bar tender makes good drinks and it's never overly crowded.
author: Mike G.

description: Cozy little bar with a tame crowd which was nice for  a couple just looking for a drink and a place to chill. Fireplace with couches was a nice touch, but seems like hot real estate (only 2 couches near the fire). Drinks were decent though not imaginative. Not a great cocktail lounge (not sure it professes to be, though) but a step up from the neighborhood bars that pepper the area. Keep your drink requests to those with no more than 2 ingredients and you should be fine.
author: Andrea E.

description: Great bartender and good place to bring a date for a drink.
author: Rob K.

description:
This is the place you drink with locals in Inner Sunset and get to know your local bartender. 

They play great alternative music, practically a Red Hot Chili Peppers radio. When was the last time you heard a bar play songs from the By the Way album? If that isn't your thing, there's always a jukebox

And if there's no couple that decides to have a 3 hour date here, you might have a chance to sit by the fire 

Otherwise the decorations are up so you can also sit by the christmas tree while drinking some Chimay
author: Andrew D.

description: Chill vibe, classy ambiance, polite staff, and great prices.   Went on a Friday night around 10:00pm it was not too crowded ;we were able to find a comfy seat and hear each other.  I had a very good time :) Very impressed.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Nice bar.  Good if you are in a small group since there are a few tables.  

Can get pretty packed, which can make sitting tricky.  Wish there were single tables. 

Not a good place to hold a big event.  There's not much of a central area for people to gather unless everyone knows each other well. 

Good ginger ale.  Most bars' tap ginger ale tastes flat, but this place's tastes fresh.
author: Joseph B.

description: Pretty nice little bar. I like the beer and whiskey selection and the Art Deco furnishings and really cool light fixtures. Why they added a bunch of TVs playing sports and have a jukebox with abrasive rock I'm not really sure. It's also apparently dog friendly- two beautiful huskies there when we were leaving. Not a ton of seating but reasonable noise level to have a nightcap.
author: Nora C. E.

description: Super rude bartender. He was rude to every customer who approached the bar. I honestly couldn't tell if he was actually the bartender or some homeless guy off the street.
author: Russell W.

description:
Cozy. Straightforward. Come as you are. This local bar has comfortable seating that's perfect for group of friends or a date.

Added PERK: being able to bring in your own food or have it delivered, plus affordable pitchers of beer, and right off the N line or 14 bus stop!
author: Regina D.

description:
Dive-in neighborhood bar to grab affordable drink & watch a game. Bar definitely needs some "facelift". Good news for dog lovers- dogs are allowed inside. 
Would not recommend this place for a date, may be only for those who met on Tinder :)
Take your girl to the upscale place "InnerFog" just down the street.
author: Ellie J.

description:
Stopped by here with a few friends on a Saturday night.  It wasn't packed at all and we were quickly able to grab seats near the fireplace. 

They had a great selection on alcohol including Distillery 209, which is my poison of choice ;).  The bartender was attentive and the drinks were very fairly priced; i.e. $6/drink.

It's a great place to bring a date after dinner.  The place is darkly lit and the fireplace adds a great touch.  The place can be a bit loud when you add the crowd talking with the music, but in the end my group was able to have a great time just sitting around and catching up.

Note: The place is pet friendly which I think is awesome.
author: Pia V.

description:
Let me set the scene.... We ordered mediocre wine and were perfectly content hanging out for the night. Although we were perfectly quiet and pleasant, the bartender was the rudest human being I have ever met in my wine buzzed life. Let me rephrase...a horrifically rude bartender. I am a inner sunset local and have NEVER been treated so rudely in my entire life. My group was so genuinely shocked that we went back in at the end of the night to say something to the bartender. He flipped my boyfriend off!! Lol. Guess my insanely generous tip was offensive to him?

Being a frequent visitor to inner sunset restaurants and bars, I just couldn't believe how insanely awful this bartender was!! Looking back, maybe we weren't hipster enough...? The only regret I have about the whole night (besides paying him at all...) was that I didn't insist on making the bartender call the owner so we could address the issue with him present.

I hate writing negative reviews but this was just too ridiculous not to write a review. It's my duty to warm you before you enter this place...be prepared for an awful experience!
author: Laura M.

description: Gotta give it to Irving street for having all these cozy ass bars. Four stars because the long island I ordered was STRONG and finally a bar that doesn't blast music so loud that I can't hear myself think.
author: Legendary W.

description:
When it comes to "good" neighborhood bars, there's a handful of traits I look for:

- Welcoming feel
- Friendly bartenders
- Neighborhood locals in the crowd (or else it's not a neighborhood joint)
- And, most importantly...good, cheap drinks

Fortunately for Fireside, they hit on all of the above.  Walking in, it almost feels like you're entering someone's living room rather than a bar.  They have couches right by the fireplace opposite the bar, TV's hanging in the corners, and a digital jukebox on the back wall offering a random variety of songs.  Not so fortunately though, the place is pretty dark.  I understand it's a bar that's going for the "by the fire side" theme, but it was pretty hard to see the bottles of beer and alcohol on the wall.  Also, seating is scarce if you don't show up early enough - even though the bar wasn't packed when we left, every available chair and table was taken.  Then again, what do you expect when you have that many people hanging out inside someone's living room?  I mean, bar?

Even though Yancy's will always be my favorite bar (especially around 9th Ave), Fireside is a pretty awesome alternative to grab some drinks with friends.  Definitely has that nice, cozy feel to it, and where else are you going to be able to sit around a fireplace with drinks in hand on a cold Sunset night?  Other than your house that is...
author: Mike L.

description: Great little hole in the wall bar by my buddy's new digs. Friendly staff and great beer selection plus a jukebox! Will be back!
author: Joe I.

description: Great space if you want to relax and have a beer, not much activity going on and music is usually decent on volume. Option to play own songs on juke box. Bartenders are attentive most of the time and the prices are not only fair but they are affordable.
author: Heather H.

description:
This place is pretty neat, many seatings with a fireplace opposite from the bar so you can cozy up. Came here around 9/10pm (ish) on a Sat night and it wasn't too crowded. Got a 50% off from Scoutmob (on a $10 tab max) so first drink is on the house! I really liked the cosmo, good sipper and not too strong on the alcohol, a great balance. Once it got later, the crowd started to built up and as the people got louder, so did the jukebox and before you know it, you're screaming on top of your lung to talk to your friends.

Pretty good crowd here, young professionals (my type of place to be). Pretty hip place, it's definitely a little bit more classier than a dive bar, but not so classy that you can still be comfortable in jeans. If you're looking to get loud and crazy, come after 10pm on the weekend but seating is not guaranteed. Otherwise, nice place to just lounge around and sip on a drink while socializing with friends or gazing out their large glass window.
author: Elaine Y.

description: all the bartenders here!!  Great prices on booze, dog friendly & great environment....check out the specials on the board & ask about the happy specials wont be disappointed at all!!!   Dog friendly spot w doggie treats :-)
author: Jennifer C.

description: Sometimes people hire 21 year olds, and 21 year olds hide in the break room, when ex boyfriends show up. So don't hire 21 year olds.
author: Steve B.

description: Most comfortable bar I've been to in a looong time. In town with my wifey, met up with an old friend (who bartends elsewhere!) to catch up and spent a few hours getting to know a great bunch of locals that were all super friendly. We are die hard Dodger fans and were totally welcomed into this Giants bar! Lagunitas on tap made it all the better. Was blown away with my check at the end of the night in the best way. Ubered our way back to Japan town feeling great. Will never go through SF without stopping by here for a drink. Thanks for the good time :)
author: Chris S.

description: Wow my friends and I just got kicked out of bar for racism. Persian and Asian who had waters and weren't welcome
author: Alexander P.

description:
THE WISHING WELL

is what is used to be called back a few years ago, Mario worked there and Larry owned it. Great place - definitely more Dive style, but Fireside has cleaned up and gotten modern. A lot of the same regulars show up - a good regular crowd, sharper than the average regulars. 

The bartenders are cool, reasonable drink prices, and a stepped up atmosphere - a lot nicer than back in the day. It feels warm on cool nights with the fireplace, and a good place to kick back and chill.
author: Rew C.

description: Fuck this place. Bar tender doesn't understand the idea of good customer service. Fat condescending asshole who makes shitty drinks. I was excited to try this place out but the service and shitty drinks really ruined it for me. I will never come back here. Service sucks. Drinks suck. Only good thing about this place is the location.
author: Kaila H.

description: Totally decent place with a cool lounge environment. Beware of the jukebox a holes, some guy was playing Hard Metal and totally ruining the vibe. Drinks aren't to expensive and it was easy to find seats.
author: Mark Y.

description:
I love the Inner Sunset. It's easy to get to, but just far enough out there to be peaceful and quiet, with hardly a tourist in sight. It is the perfect neighborhood for the Fireside Bar, because who doesn't want to sit on a couch in a cozy bar by a fireplace in one of the coldest, foggiest places in the city?

The bartenders are friendly, (they have no qualms about opening up and revealing information about their personal lives, as well lol) I love the atmosphere, and the drinks are surprisingly affordable. Great neighborhood bar, perfect if you want to relax and escape the hustle of downtown.
author: Angela S.

description:
Your experience here depends heavily on who is bartending. Most of the bartenders are cool and pleasant, but there's one guy who never fails to be rude and slow, and frequently can't handle a full bar so you have to wait forever for drinks when he's there.

That said, I really like this bar. So much so that I came here for my 22nd birthday and New Year's Eve. The location is great, huge variety of restaurants and bars in walking distance. The bar is very cozy with nice booth seating and a great fireplace (hence the name). They also have the nicest jukebox I've ever seen. 

Lots of great bars in the Inner Sunset and this one is at the top of the list.
author: Kelsey L.

description: Very chill neighborhood bar. Came here on a Wed night and sat at the bar with a couple of buddies drinking Black Butte Porter. It was a good time.
author: Andy H.

description:
I don't drink much anymore because it's terrible for you, but I bet this bar would be cool, if the one of bartenders there didn't have such a bad attitude.

You can't just simply accept a tip for a glass of club soda without giving me a hard time because why? Yeah, I did actually want that drink I just ordered. And, yes, I am over 21 - thanks!

No really, though, I always do find it amusing when men such as yourself can't just be nice to women like me. Thanks for the giggle!
author: Katie D.

description:
Beers on tap were reasonably priced. Nice group of regulars anchored the bar. The men's room could have been cleaner, but it's a bar after all.

It's a good stop on a bar crawl in the Inner Sunset!
author: Greg S.

description: Literally fireside. Makes for a cozy environment. My friends in Sunset love to drop by here, Good place to chill and drink.
author: Angela L.

description: Super chill atmosphere, quiet enough to chat with a friend.. or a date. All I got was a greyhound, so I can't speak on their beer list/cocktail prowess. Great local bar though.
author: Vivian H.

description:
You want to come here late-night on a weekend, and definitely when it's cold and foggy.

ATMOSPHERE: Cozy. Bring a good friend to catch-up with or a significant other here...they'll be impressed.

SERVICE: The bartenders are friendly, but deducting a star because they only have one person managing the whole bar at times. That means long waiting times for a beer - even when there is no one else in line.
author: Kevin C.

description:
It was relatively quiet on a Friday which is no surprise. Not many people roam over to the Sunset to party on a Friday night. Fireside was definitely lively though. Their drinks are affordable and the ambiance is down to earth and laid back.

I'd come to Fireside if I was in the area, sure!
author: Rosa L.

description: Was at Fireside last night; kick ass bartender, she was more than willing to make suggestions on what to drink when my date didn't know even when it was busy and was very fast: Super friendly and also very beautiful! Will be coming back Saturday nights!!!
author: Sean A.

description: We had some time to kill before dinner down the street so we decided to pop in here for a drink. Seemed to be a mix of locals and UCSF students. There was a decent selection of  micro-brews on tap and in bottles, as well as projection TV showing the Giants game and a cozy fireplace were added bonuses. Only downside was the female bartender was all business, not even a hint of a smile or friendliness.
author: Bumble B.

description:
So we come here frequently. They always serve great drinks, great service, great music, great vibe. It's not too crowded, but no where near empty. This is the place to be.

And bonus... The curved end to the bar. Seriously, if you frequent bars --- you know what I'm talking about. It makes the bar elbow lean comfy. Nice touch. Reminds me of one of my favorite haunts in NYC when I lived there.
author: Zoe D.

description:
Despite the fact that the fireplace wasn't aglow, a cozy dive bar nonetheless. No food. 

We were there on a Friday evening, and there was plenty of room. I could actually hear my friends talk. Despite my typical preference for beer, I ordered one of their chocolate raspberry vodka soda drinks. It was mixed pretty well. The bartender looks like Russell Crowe, and has the perfect gruffness-to-helpfulness ratio. If I lived in the Sunset, I would probably go back.
author: Heidi H.

description: Great little neighborhood bar, not tough to find a little nook to sit in, and they have a nice fireplace in the center. Good vibe, everyone's nice.
author: Shaina N.

description:
Decided to give this place a try after reading some positive reviews.  Showed up around 11 on a Saturday night and was surprised that there were only 10-15 people in the whole bar.  That worked for us because we were with a little group and wanted to be able to talk to each other, and we were able to control the jukebox.  First impressions were decent - nice artwork, candles on the tiny 18" roundtop tables, cool looking benches, a large projection TV, and reasonably priced beers.

After serving us our first round of drinks, the only bartender went outside for a cigarette.  Fifteen minutes later, she was still outside, smoking and making out with some guy who may have also worked there, as he was spraying down tables later in the night.  When she finally came back inside, she went straight to the bathroom for a few minutes until my girlfriend got so fed up she went in after her and finally ushered her back to the bar to serve another round of drinks.  I closed out my tab immediately for fear of her leaving again and my card being stranded. Overall our group had a fine time but we won't be back -  I can't take a place seriously when the only staff member(s) are absent for 20 minutes straight in the middle of a Saturday night.
author: Mark B.

description:
The bartender tried to rip up my drivers license.  I am 23, tall, dressed like an adult.  There is no excuse for that.  If you can't recognize an ID, even if it isn't the new fancy CA one, just the old kind,  you need a serious refresher in what a legal ID looks like.  As someone who works in the Emergency Medicine system, I even have a CHP sticker on there.  No one has ever questioned my ID.  Why? BECAUSE IT'S REAL.

I went in to meet a guy friend for a drink on Friday night, whom she did NOT card, and sit down.  First, she can't work the tap and sprays me with the beer over the tap.  I smile, tell her no problem, I understand, very calm and polite, no reason for her to take offense and give me a hard time.  She then takes 5 minutes to ask me what I'd like, and when I order a jameson neat, cards me.  Okay fine, I think, I look under 30, no big deal.  I used to work as a bartender, I understand the uncertainty.  Next thing I know, the bartender is using the candle to see my id, which, last I checked, doesn't work like a blacklight, and turns to me and tells me loudly that it's a fake, she can't take this, the photo is in the wrong place and grabs it to tear it in half.  Now, I work on an ambulance and need my DL in order to DO MY JOB, and convince her not to tear it only by offering her a look at anything else in my wallet, and all but freaking out.  She still refuses to serve me, giving me attitude the whole time, but thank goodness gives me back my DL.  My friend and I take our business over to a bar down the street where the bartender doesn't even bat an eye.

Look, I understand that the fireside gets a lot of underage drinkers, lord knows everyone knew to go there in high school, but when you can't recognize a real ID just because it isn't the new one that all the transplants are handing you and almost put me out of work until the DMV can give me a new DL?  Entirely unacceptable.
Learn your freaking job.
author: Jo P.

description: Worst bartender on earth, overweight asshole questioning my order of a margarita. 'Do you even understand that we don't have a blender!??' YES I prefer it on the rocks you idiot! Figure it out. This place blows, the drink was watered down and had a bad sour taste to it. Don't go here.
author: Steven S.

description: Smokin hot bartender. Good pours. Odd mix crowd. Not as hipster as expected. Pleasant cross section of the Sunset.
author: Tim P.

description:
This is a great bar! The crowd is always friendly and never pretentious. The bartenders and owner make some cheap, strong, stiff drinks. TV's playing, there's a digital jukebox type of thing for music, darts, and even a fireplace for warmth! I've even seen people order whole pizzas and have them delivered to the bar.

One of my memorable visits here:

Girl: Excuse me, but I think this is yours. I think you dropped it in the bathroom. *hands me my driver's license*

Me: Oh...! Thanks! How'd you know it was mine?!

Girl: ...

My BF: IT HAS YOUR PICTURE ON IT, DRUNKIE!

Yup. Many a good tipsy times here. They even have happy hour and wine! wiiiinnne!
author: Liana L.

description: Solid place. Nice dive type of feel, which makes it very comfortable and relaxed. Will be back.
author: Brian H.

description: Chill bar, good place to come with friends to knock back a few beers and chat.  Gets crowded and very loud on sports games nights, but which bar doesn't?  The music is also fairly loud.  Seems to have friendly locals.  I did pay with credit card, so no longer cash only as the Yelp info indicates.
author: Renee L.

description: This is cool great divy bar.  I ordered a gin and soda which tasted like it was watered down so I ordered red wine .  This was a better choice than my first drink so I had  two.   They have a fireplace which was a cool touch and allows dogs inside.  Their juke box is pretty advanced and cool looking.
author: Claudine V.

description:
UGGHHH. One of the WORST experiences I've had at a bar in San Francisco.  I was finishing up a glass of wine and literally had the glass taken OUT OF MY HAND by one of the bartenders at 1:52am because they were shutting down at 2am.  We were the only ones at the bar/literally on our last sip of wine and got YELLLED at repeatedly/practically ASSAULTED so that the bartenders could leave early.  I live blocks away from this place, am really friendly, easy going, never write reviews like this, etc., but will never, EVER return (and telling all of my friends to do the same). So sorry to write a review like this (this is the first review I've ever written in this manner! really!), but I think it's only fair for everyone to know what they're getting into ahead of time. 

That being said, the Inner Fog next door (or down the block) was great.  SUPER nice staff, etc. and a great wine selection.  Highly recommend it over this place..any day.
author: Millay K.

description: Pretty typical neighborhood bar, pretty chill local crowd and nice bartenders. There's a nice fireplace that you can take a seat by. Great low-key bar to sit and chill with friends. Drinks are pretty cheap. They also serve wine!
author: Elaine N.

description: My friend lives around the corner from this place. It's never crowded when we go mid-week, usually after dinner to finish our conversation over a glass of wine. They have a descent selection of wine, and a very knowledgeable staff. It's on the "Foggy" side of SF which gives the interior a musky-bar feel. The bartenders are fun to chat with if you are in the mood to do so, and I've always got into a conversation with another local while I've been there! Maybe I'll consider myself one of them if I move to the city for good!?
author: Cameron B.

description:
5 stars for a Rockin' NYE @ The Fireside. Any evening involving Sierra on tap, a marriage proposal (x2) from a random stranger (ok, he was hanging out by the ladies room asking everyone with a cootchysnortcher, but still), Fishbits, KayJay, AG, Cath B, Andrew T, Lancehole, Doeke, Poe, Marcella, Ruthifer and various spouses and hangers on, a fireplace, party favors, one husband asking juuuuust the wrong person to light his fire *cough* (where AG & Marcella go, lighter problems follow)....OG '07! WooHoo.

The useful: Not the place to ask for fancy drinks with silly names, even when it's not New Year's Eve....but a cozy and relaxing bar with a world-class view of the N-Judah.
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
Maybe we came at a bad time but, our experience was not like these other reviews. 
I came here with two girlfriends on a friday night. The first thing I noticed about this place was a "smell". It had a sweaty people/humid musty smell that was hard to ignore. 

The bar wasn't that busy but  none of the tables had been bused so we had to clear our own table when we sat down. I also noticed that my shoes seemed to stick to the floor a lot. We tried to over look all that and stayed for two drinks. But, even then we were not impressed with the drink flavors that much either. 

Sorry to say but, I just wasn't feeling it and probably wont ever return...
author: Tuesday C.

description:
Decent/Nice bar in Sunset.

Fair variety of beer on tap but a tad bit pricey for location.

Wouldn't recommend to go out of your way, but if you're in the area and are looking for a decent place to chill, you could safely stop by this bar.
author: Ayall S.

description: Friendly neighborhood bar. Older crowd. Regulars. Projector screen for sports. A couple other TVs. Booths are set up to watch tv. Full liquor. Wine list. Limited tap selection, but good standard ones. Real fire in the fireplace. Better than average prices.
author: Brian L.

description:
Ya gotta love a bar in San Francisco, dark inside, with mood lighting sporadically placed, all cozying up to a fireplace where you can feel the warmth of the fire and hear the fire crackles....

Sounds nice, right? It could be so so so nice if they were playing some nice jazz or anything but the hard core screaming rock they were playing here for half the time we were here!! You TOTALLY ruin the mood by doing that Fireside!!! I mean heck, you call yourself Fireside for being able to sit by the fire not because the music they play makes you feel like you are on fire!!!!

The bar is cash only too, which is always a bummer in my book, but they are cheap with two mixed drinks coming in at $9, which is AMAZING in San Fran. But don't come here with a big group, because there are not that many tables---they keep it small so you are all kinda sitting by the fire, and our party of 4 barely found a table when we got here on a saturday night.

The only other thing missing...marshmallows for smores!!!
author: Sarah G.

description:
This place is hilarious. From the pictures, you would think Fireside Bar is a hipster joint with over-stuffed chairs around a crackling fire, indie art on the walls and music by Baths being played over head.

Nope.

It's actually equal parts divey and well, plain random. There fireplace was magnificently underwhelming so much so that you can't help but laugh when you get there at how different the place looks than in the pictures. The bar is really standard, almost what you would see in a movie that involves bikers or something off the side of a desolate interstate. 

The bartender was a large, gruff dude who gets a little peeved if you ask too many questions but remains pretty likeable despite your indecisiveness. The drinks were cheap (especially with the Scoutmob deal!), the bathroom is clean and it's really close to the Muni. I might be back if I ever come 'round this 'hood.
author: liz c.

description: This place makes a mean top shelf margarita. The atmosphere is very chill and dog friendly! We took our bull dogs there and everyone loved them. The bartender, a blonde woman (didn't catch her name) was super friendly and patient.
author: Paige S.

description: Went there on a whim. Heard about their fireplace and how cozy it was, wasn't disappointed. Talkative personable female bartender, generous pours and good music. Friendly clientele, not the grungy homeless guy or ghetto fabulous trying to pick up or bother you. Great for a friends get together or a drink to yourself.
author: Crystal V.

description:
3 reasons why I like this place:

1-cool neighborhood bar to just go to on a regular night when you don't want to get too crazy but still feel like going out and doing SOMEthing.
2-good beer selection and near lots of places to eat (i think you can bring in outside food too).
3-they have a FIREPLACE. having a fireplace in SF? sold!
author: Emy s.

description: Decent service for a divey bar with only one bartender working the entire bar section who also cleaned up the tables.  It's along Iriving which is near a bunch of other bars whereby parking is hard to come by late at night.  Was pretty content with their variation of the Greyhound.  The grapefruit juice didn't taste as bitter as most other places that use fruit juice made from concentrate.  They had 1 TV and plenty of seats available.
author: Hanna Y.

description:
I'm never going back to this place. I hate to post anecdotes but it's the only way to describe my awful experience with the service here:

I was taking my friend out for the night and we wanted to try some place new and I wanted to go somewhere low-key and cozy. Alas I happened upon the Fireside Bar--it's a bar and has a fireplace. Cozy, right? The ambiance was pretty much like a regular bar, darkly lit, digital jukebox, TVs broadcasting sports games. (Oh, and I didn't see it but my friend said the fireplace wasn't even real.)

After about 10 minutes, I went up to the bar to place my order. The bartender was talking to his friends at the side. I was looking his way and his friends saw me waiting and didn't say anything, the bartender himself saw me and didn't say anything, then finally he came over to me BUT only to fill up a mug with tap for his friend. I placed my order...twice (his friends were incredibly loud), and he said that it would take a while for the coffee to brew and he would need to see my ID. I stood at the bar with my ID in hand for awhile, but feeling like an idiot, I decided to sit down and wait for the coffee.

I wasn't looking at the time but my friend said we were waiting for over 30 minutes with no beverages. The bartender not so much as acknowledged us. Meanwhile at least 2 other parties came into the bar and were served immediately (and whom I doubt were not carded, mind you). After waiting for another 10 or so minutes my friend and I up and left for another bar, where they treated us like actual customers.
author: Kym M.

description:
This is my favorite bar in SF, which may seem surprising since it's not the most hipster or trendy or whatever, but 1) I live right down the street from it and 2) I've had some great conversations there, whether it be day drinking in the afternoon with people who would eventually become my closest friends, or ending the night there after going to other bars or shows. So I guess I'm just emotionally attached to this bar for the good memories it's brought me. 
I also enjoy the comfortable seating and of course, the fireside. The drinks are pretty standard; I just get a Widmer hef or a Chimay usually. The bartenders are awesome as well; one night my friend was buying rounds for all of us and at the end of the night a bartender gave him a free shot since he noticed that he was buying all the rounds and deserved to have something on the house. I'll be sad when I move in a few months and won't be right down the street anymore.
author: Jacqueline K.

description:
I can't imagine a better bar in the sunset.

Super chill, great seating and atmosphere , and best of all, really cool bartenders.

I met a friend here to catch up over pre-dinner drinks. They have a decent selection on draft. Later we had Oban on the rocks and the bartender gave us the rest of the bottle since there wasn't much left. :P
author: Kenny J.

description: Cool enough bar. Bar tenders turned down King Khan and the Shrines. You couldn't even hear it. Automatically 2 stars. Who does that?
author: Joseph N.

description:
This is officially my bar on Wed night!  Only because Sheila, the best bartender works on Wed night!

This place is a really cool spot to meet up and chat with folks before going out later into the night or just a spot to unwind on a week night.  The jukebox is one of the rarest kind that I ever find since it looks like a huge cell phone plastered onto the wall, but the jams in it are good so that's definitely a plus.  Also, if your cool enough to get your picture taken, you get to see yourself in the photo montage.  Sweet!

The ambiance at this joint is definitely chill, but seriously this place is awesome on Wed nights, solely because Sheila the best bartender is here.  She makes a wicked Malibu ......i forget what the second word was I drank too much of it...but it is definitely refreshing as promised.  Definitely the hangout on Wed nights!  Another cool part, animals can come and kick it here too....major plus!
author: Mark L.

description:
If you're looking for a casual place to hang out and avoid the weekend crowds, this might be the place!  My friends and I ended up at the Fireside Bar last night after some yummy eats at San Tung.  It is a cozy lil bar that, yes, has a fire inside.  I liked it cause it wasn't crazy busy which meant it had chairs available for our party and a short wait for drinks.  Nice crowd too... they helped us with our scavenger hunt as much as possible!  Thanks peeps!

The drinks were great too btw; verrrry inexpensive and from a friendly enough but not too much bartender!  
Read this - cheap GOOD drinks!!!

6 stars cause they're pet friendly!!  Though it is kinda weird to hear a loud BARK when you're a lil tipsy at a bar. haha!

See ya there!
author: Susan D.

description:
I've probably ended up at Fireside on a weekend night more than any other bar. It's chill and cozy--it's kind of like an oasis of calm at 1am after a night at bars with more of a "scene."

So there have been a few incidents here that would have turned me off of another bar but I like the Fireside so much I keep coming back. Like this one time, some creepy guy wouldn't leave me alone. Really, this guy made my skin crawl. And then the bartender asked him to move to the other side of the bar--he's the best bartender ever! Another time, my friend stepped in a huge pile of dog crap right as we walked outside. Okay, fine, I laughed until I cried with that one.
author: Susan S.

description: I found this bar noticeable on Irving. I went finally for the first time and liked it. There is a limited amount of seating on a busy day though. I got lucky and sat right by the fire. The fire is different for the bar and that's why I like it. Just another bar on Irving, but definitely adds variety to the scene there.
author: Denise C.

description:
I used to come here ALL the time, but this was about 6-7 or maybe even 8 years ago.  I remember the bartenders being really great and the local patrons being friendly.  

Fast forward to present day.  I was suppose to meet up with some friends at that new wine bar but of course I was punctual and they were late.  I walked right into Fireside and sat at the bar next to a regular, named Fred.  I ordered a glass of wine and chatted with this Fred until I heard from my friends, and for the record, they were over a hour late.  The bartender was very nice and everything is just so casual and not stuck up like at those SOMA bars for happy hour.  Fireplace rocks too!
author: Rosalind S.

description:
Politics and booze don't mix:

They kicked my friend out for kissing her girlfriend.  

Umm.. what?  

Come on guys... 2010 in the city of San Francisco. Can't two people feel safe to be like any other couple?

Classless, hypocritical, and it's important to know that this place chooses not to be gay friendly.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description: Love this place! Feels like a Small town bar. People who keep the place running are incredibly friendly and give a feel that most of San Francisco has lost. Will come back hear over and over. Always consistent.
author: Patrique R.

description: Love this place! Dark, fireplace, friendly bartender, (no attitude... guess which evening) good music loud enough to note hear your neighbor's conversation. Two things would change if i could: take the music volume from 11 to 7, and supplant the guitar rock with monk, sonny rollins, etc.
author: Sean S.

description:
Fireside is probably the most happening bar on Irving, unless you're really into sports, beer, and large screen tv's.  

I love a bar with plenty of seating, which this one definitely fits the bill.    They've also got good drinks (mojitos!), cheap drinks, a jukebox, and as the name suggests, a cozy little fireplace.  A little loud, but that may just be a sign of my old age.

Slightly divey, but not horrible.  Cash only.
author: Joanne G.

description:
Fireside is my go to Neighborhood bar.
Always have a place to sit
Drinks are easy to get and on the cheaper side.
Its never too crowded or too empty.
Its close to home
Atmosphere is nice with art on the walls, a fireplace and red hues
Love the barn door
Eclectic mix of people
author: Kra C.

description:
I met up with some friends at this bar last night. I had passed by it several times, but hadn't tried it out.

The place is fairly small, as most neighborhood bars are. On A Saturday night at 11 there was plenty of space to move around and sit. It's has a nice cozy feel to it. Bathroom is nasty, completing the neighborhood bar ambiance. However, they have a digital jukebox playing loud music, and there is no dance floor. This is stupid. The music made it hard to have conversations unless you were right next to the person talking into their ear. They'd be much better off turning the music down or off completely.

My friend got a Sierra Nevada off the tap from the unfriendly bartender. They did not have Blue Moon on tap. Weak, and points off in my book. 

Overall the bar is alright. It's not terribly sketchy, but there are problems with it. I would not go again unless i was meeting people there.
author: J C.

description:
Nice quiet little spot. Prices are pretty good. Layout of the place is a little weird, but the fireplace is nice, warm and toasty. I like the jukebox the most. Very modern, it's like a giant Ipod mounted on the wall.

It's a nice place to be to just relax by the fire and catch up.
author: Jenny M.

description:
The prices here are pretty good... the staff is really friendly.  Good beers on tap... They lose points on the feel of the bar.  The have a neat fireplace and all that with candles but its laid our really weird.  There are booths placed randomly and tables in other spots.... just not a good flow.

It is however a nice place to go for a drink when you don't feel like getting crazy because it is a mellow bar.
author: Jessica J.

description:
Not in the mood for complete sentences, so here goes.

Saturday night. Not super crowded. Interesting mixed crowd (to watch).
Sexy santas in mini skirts.
Comfy seat. Plenty of tables (8 tables count as plenty in a bar, right?).
No dog this time :(
$6 drinks. Bartender seems to be in a bad mood. Dunno why.
Tiger/Cheetah Woods scandal on the telly.
Clean bathroom.
Fireplace.

Me like.
author: Ari C.

description:
Wow. I had to laugh at Tal K's review. "You know, it's too bad. With a couple of turntables and a complete staff/patron makeover, this place could really be a nice lounge in the Inner Sunset." Gimme a break, go back to the Mission. The name of it is "Fireside Bar" not "Another generic lounge with all the same looking people". Sorry their flatulence offended your ears. 

I appreciate that kind of laid back style. They were just as carefree when I was there. The bar had a great feel, noone under 30, a nice mix of people, good seating, beautiful fireplace. Wide variety of music. This place is perfect. Nothing wrong. Will recommend to my friends, and will come back again. I hope the same awesome dog is there next time I come. He was adorable.
author: Oz B.

description: Love this place. Strong drinks, reasonable prices, good crowd and atmosphere. It's a little loud, so not the greatest place to have conversations unless you want to yell, but good to just unwind with a few friends. It's usually decently crowded no matter what the day but the bartender is always attentive. There's only one stall in the women's bathroom and that sucks, but at least it's always stocked with TP.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
You know, I like the Fireside Bar. 

It's close to home, cozy, drinks are cheap and the fire is warm. I really do like this place and the fact that they allow dogs; dogs are always a good addition to a bar. I've been a few times, both when it's nearly empty and really packed, and it's always fun and comfortable.
The bartenders have always been great and I officially met Steve last night who completely took care of us and kept up with the crowd.

Overall this is a great, casual place to hang out and enjoy some booze.
author: Denise S.

description:
Sometimes there are dogs in the bar - yay!
The ambiance is really mellow - woohoo!
There are TVs so if your date ain't going well, at least you have something to look at - yippie!
The bartender poured my Guinness correctly - aww yeah!!!
The pint of Guinness cost me $6 - WHAT!?! *sad face*

Or maybe I just don't go out as much as I used to and that's the new going rate for a pint of Guinness? If so - *permanent sad face.* Clearly, the terrorists have won.... ):
author: Chung N.

description: This bar is very dog friendly, which is awesome, but if you're dog friendly you have to be a bit more cleanly than normal. The smell of the whole place is not super pleasant. The bartender was very nice, although he didn't quite know what beers they offered. Prices are great though. If I lived in the neighborhood I might return, but I definitely wouldn't go out of my way to come here.
author: Lauren D.

description: This is the perfect spot to catch up with a friend you haven't seen in a while.  Or to wrap up a second or third date in.  It has couches by a fire, a cozy ambiance that is quiet enough to talk but lively enough that it doesn't feel sedated.  The drinks are well priced, and the bartenders are always super friendly.
author: David G.

description:
Was looking for a bar. We passed a wine bar, we kept walking, looked too fancy. Then we saw Fireside. It wasn't really busy. It had a fireplace and the seats in front of it were available. There are 3 tv's placed around the bar showing sports, that's key. There is an digital jukebox that is constantly flashing colours. The washroom is pretty gross, but that was expected. Drinks were cheap, I think. I think I bought 3 beers, 1 mixed drink and a coke for $16. 

Anyway, we didn't stay long, but I could have seen that happening for us. It is a really relaxed atmosphere.
author: Andrew Y.

description: Nice place to warm up in the Sunset during those chilly, foggy evenings.  The fireplace inside keeps you warm and toasty if you can manage to grab a table in front.  They have rotating drinks deals, and the prices are inexpensive.  A great place to kickback and unwind.  I like the ambiance and mellow atmosphere.  Stays open late (2am) which makes this place a prime spot to hangout with your friends any day of the week.
author: Anthony R.

description:
Fireside is a friendly neighborhood bar, complete with awesome bartenders and a cool doorman.  You walk in and it looks like you stepped in someone's fancy modern living room instead of a bar.  Comfy couches and a fireplace?  Count me in!

Chimay on tap!
author: Jenny L.

description: Great place to have a drink next to the fire and watch a game.  I love that they allow dogs and the vibe is always friendly.
author: jon c.

description:
Small, cozy and cute.

I started off w/ a red bull/vodka while my friend got a greyhound-esque drink (I believe it was cranberry vodka + club soda). The total came out to $11. Not bad. We came in right before it got semi-busy so we were able to snag a table.

I didn't really see the fireplace, but it was super warm inside the bar. I wasn't expecting it to be THAT warm in there.

The bathrooms can be confusing for newcomers. The guy's bathroom is next to the "employees only" room while the girl's bathroom is on the other side. I saw a lot of girls walk into the guys bathroom because they couldn't see the sign for the girl's bathroom. I saw the mistakes these ladies made so when I had to use the bathroom, I knew the right way to go.

Then, I ordered a cranberry/vodka while my friend got a midori sour. The total came out to $11.50. Not too shabby.

It can get pretty loud in there and the music selection isn't always the best, but overall the bar itself is not too bad.
author: Justine O.

description: This bar was so welcoming and fun! Had a great time surrounded by fun and charming people. Quick, easy, and just what I was looking for. Convenient location in the sunset!
author: Sarah G.

description:
This definitely looks more like a regular bar than a wine bar. We came in here while we were waiting to get seated at Lavash. For a Friday evening it was not crowded at all, but yes, they had the Scoutmob 50% for up to $10 off on Foursquare. I wanted my bf to use it on his $5 beer, but he insisted on giving the local place some business and put my phone away. 

Anyway, we were here for a short period of time, but the place seemed okay. I'd like to  come back and try the wines to see how I like it.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Yes it's all true, even the rumors. We stopped just short of burning this place to the ground on NYE. The locals didn't even flinch when a group (or grope) of Yelpers commandeered about half of their bar.

The place is a lounge with a faint whiff of dive which is just fine by me. The bartenders were seriously kicking ass, Even though it was packed the drinks were coming fast and furious. Don't ask me about the prices, I don't remember but it didn't appear to knock too big of a hole in my wallet.

A good time was had by all and if I lived in this neighborhood I'd definitely be a regular.
author: Lance G.

description:
Not bad, pretty chill and a good amount of people on a Monday night. They have a cool fancy jukebox!

The drinks were cheap! Well for someone who lives in LA. I got two Long Islands and a Stella for only $20. 

Friendly staff and patrons.
author: Jenn S.

description:
how can i not give it 5 stars? a nice, cozy bar with a fireplace. NO COVER on new year's eve. cheap drink specials(my amaretto sour was a perfect drink considering how baked i was), fishbits rocking the beats, meeting a bunch of yelpers i had never met before. unfortunately a "rival" high schooler was there, and that kind of dampened my night. but that is no fault of fireside. 

*highlight of the night* was yelpers going outside to get HIGH, except they had no LIGHT. so, they asked someone who was smoking a cigarette. unfortunately he was a cop...
author: Andrew T.

description:
I don't really get it but I kind of like it. There are no foofy cocktails, there's no pretentious crowd, and the bartender seemed upfront and down to earth. I almost thought we weren't in San Francisco anymore. I was informed that this is how it's done in the Avenues...

There is indeed a fireplace and we did indeed sit fireside. Like and like. It was opposite day, so my happy hour partner (Stephan) and I went with beer for the first time since oh...before I was born and beer is pretty hard to screw up. An old friend met us and while regaling us with tales of his recent gay yoga retreat vacation (he's straight), he appeared to enjoy sipping a Manhattan, so I'm guessing their mixed drinks are ok too. He also left the cherry for me (thank you, Eli), which gets him 5 stars. 

Not a bad choice if you're on Irving and don't want to contend with the rowdies at Yancy's.
author: Autumn K.

description: This little bar just got even better than it was before- it's dog friendly! So much so that the bartender kept feeding him treats! All of the local patrons were super friendly and talkative and all liked my dog as well. It's basically just a small, cozy bar with good style. They also play really good music, which is always a huge plus. I'm definitely a fan!
author: Sonya D.

description:
Fireside is a strange place. Based on other reviews, I think I came here with a much higher expectation of what I would find. The bartender is fabulous and friendly, and the drinks were fine. But the furniture is NOT comfy, and this is not a place to bring a group of people to (6 people huddled around two tiny tables). I also found the atmosphere curiously lacking - but I think that is due to the slight spartan decor. I also felt that for a bar that is categorized as dive, having open windows which allow you to stare out at the outside/reality (and vice versa) a little offputting. 

On the upside, although the bar does not serve food, they have no problem with you bringing in food from one of the nearby establishments.   I also liked the saloon style door - that could keep me amused for hours!
author: Catriona C.

description: Great place to chill out. Definitely worth to visit. Super nice people. Love this place ...
author: Unyo N.

description: Cozy place to grab a drink and chill with friends.  It's kind of small and there's no food, but they do have a fireplace!  Bartender was super nice about my friend being indecisive about drinks and sampling half the beers on tap.
author: Alix C.

description:
I'm bumping Fireside up to 5 because it's harder than you think to find a chill bar on a Saturday night.  I love suggesting this spot if you want to grab a drink and actually be able to talk at a comfortable volume with your companion.   I bring people here all the time who have walked this block hundreds of times, never noticing this bar.  Despite the 150 + reviews for Fireside, I still classify it as a hidden gem.  Also , the music and the service consistently awesome.  

You will certainly find me sitting in front of this riproaring fireplace in the coming winter, sipping on a Stella or a mediocre merlot :)
author: Kerry D.

description:
Besides being crazy boring inside and that the crowd is strangely diverse yet lacking in substance....is that the patrons have no consideration that it's a neighborhood bar.  Not everyone drinks on a Monday until 1am.  Shut the fuck up you drunk asses.

Conversations heard from drunk Fireside patrons as they shout at each other on their way home...right past my window.
  
(Please note that they shout even though they are walking side by side)

Convo #1:

beeyotch:  YOU GUYS!!!  HURRY THE FUCK UP!!! 
skank ho:  SHUT UP BITCH!!
beeyotch:  SERIOUSLY, HURRY!!  OH MY GAWD!!  WAS THAT GUY LIKE TOTALLY CUTE?  HE WAS SO OLD THOUGH...LIKE 30 SOMETHING!!
skank ho: SHUT UP BITCH!!

Convo #2

douche bag:  DUDE!!  WHAT NOW?
ass wipe:       FUCK IF I KNOW...WHERE DID THAT GIRL SAY SHE LIVED? SHE TOTALLY INVITED US OVER!
douche bag :  GOT ANY POT?  
ass wipe:      SHE HAD NICE TITS.
douche bag:  I NEED SOME WEED.

Convo #3: 

bar grandpa: *COUGH* HACK* SPIT* SNORT* HACK* SNIF* COUGH* HACK* SPIT*
bar grandpa #2: You need another beer.

Last but not least...

Convo #4

guy #1:  Dude let's go to The Comet Club!
guy #2:  Sweet...I'm there.
They turn the car on and bumpin' from thier speakers....???   "GIRL YOU KNOW IT'S TRUE...OOO OOO OOOHHH....I LOVE YOU!"

I shit you not.
author: Jay H.

description:
1 star for, I forgot to order anything to drink but I was talking with Tony L. for a good one hour.

1 star for, nice comfortable seats.

1 star for, watched euge's Korean special top & bottom less berry dance for free.
author: Nobu K.

description:
The Fireside used to be a really scary, crusty dive bar before the latter was popular or cool. The Wishing Well I think it was called? More like wish you never fall into in the Bukowski-like well that the degenerate patrons found themselves in. And this is coming from ME, spokeswoman for DYL.

It's reemerged with a makeover and cozy fireplace that you makes you want to wear V-neck sweaters and channel your inner Andy Williams/Perry Como for relaxing Suntori times.
author: Suzanne R.

description:
Nice and clean, awesome fireplace, small little tables, good size bar, a complicated electric jukebox, good price drinks, central local, and nice bartenders.  

Good for: A place to go with your friends to catch up on small talk, or perhaps a place to meet your date (and then move on to somewhere else). 

Bad for: Getting shitty (not enough room to dance and music isn't loud enough), or meeting new people (everyone is in groups and clicky).
author: Vicky B.

description:
I remember going here once back in the day when this bar had a different name and was frequented by mostly 'old-timers'...the kind of crusty, cantankerous cats my dad used to hang with when he'd take me and my brother with him to the 'track' (aka Bay Meadows or Golden Gate Fields) back when we were kids.

I didn't see any 'old-timers' on recent visits to this place, but I did enjoy some great, well-priced beers and fast, friendly service! That crescent of couches around that funky fireplace looks really cool too, but those seats are obviously at a premium and fill up pretty quickly...

This is definitely a bar I'd frequent again, and it provides a nice, mellow contrast to the craziness that often ensues at Yancy's...they are also dog-friendly (for those of you with pooches).
author: Art D.

description:
I'm not sure what to call this bar, a dive or not. Dive bars don't have fireplaces nor three big screen TV's.

Things I like, the cozy fireplace and sports on TV. Beers on tap, especially Chimay, Hef, and Good ole Guinness.

However I HATE the smelly men's room. Could they clean it every once in a while, then maybe I might patronize the place.
author: Stanley K.

description:
Euge was busy to drop his pants for me..  sigh~  need evidential pictures..

Omar was busy to get Tequila shots to get me drunk.. and hold my both hands..

Hen was busy to pretend not speaking Korean..

Guri was busy to select good jukebox  music..

Tony and Nobu were busy to talk to each other..

Sooj and I were busy to die for laughing!

otherwise, I really don't remember..  give me one more chance!
author: Julie K.

description:
Came here last night with Kimby T to have a drink and see my photos hanging from the establishment.....it looked great!

So we bellyed up to the bar and the bar tender had asked for our ID's and she was so nice to me...she said that I dont even look my age she thought that I was in my mid 20's....That was sweet. And so we order our drinks and admire the walls....

The crowd was okay. Althougth for a Thursday night was full. Its for sure the neighborhood bar. Not sure if this be cosider a dive bar or a sports bar....in any case its dog friendly, so even the cute fury face are welcome to come and have a drink or two. It has a warm feel to it I guess its because of the fireplace they hav.....

The reason for three stars  there was nothing REALLY special about this place except for my photos hanging....;)
Go check it out.....
author: Der Maibaum L.

description:
I like that this is a bar where friends go. You don't go here to pick up guys/girls, it's just a nice warm place to go to grab some drinks with a buddy. I like that there's a fireplace there. I like that the bartender will greet my friends and me with, "what can I do for you, beautiful?" and it's NOT in a creepy way. I like that he'll give me an honest opinion on what drinks to try (or not try) if I want to experience something new.

I just like the Fireside, a lot.
author: Courtney S.

description: I had to check this place. It is perfect for a cold night when the marine layer is blanketing the city. There are not many dive bars with a fire place. They don't serve food but they do serve strong drinks. This place is a keeper for an after dinner drink if someone happens to be out in the sunset.
author: Christian A.

description:
This is the third review I have written this week about a bar that got a face lift.....Woody Zips was first, then Annies Social Club and now Fireside. 

I am getting all sentimental. I actually have seen this cities drinking establishments go through some major changes. I may need to create another drinking establishment list (as if I don't have enough already). 

I am going to take this time to reminisce. I remember sitting in this place when it was the Wishing Well. The bartender was so tanked he actually poured equal amounts of alcohol on the bar and in my glass. I sat next to a regular who had just returned from Reno and he proceeded to pull out a bottle of moonshine and pass it around to all of the other regulars, as well as the bartender. Oh, yes, when it came around to me I most certainly took a healthy swig. 

This place has managed to transform from the biggest shit hole in the area to the nicest bar in the hood. Its clean, friendly, good selection,has a fireplace and candles on the tables for ambiance, the bartender is not slurring and the customers are no longer toothless and BYOBing.

Not that I'm knocking the shit hole it used to be......oh, the sweet memories!!!
author: Drue C.

description:
Note to self: If for some unforeseeable reason, at an event where a number of women cannot make the dinner leaving the imbalance of gender between sexes 2 to 9, where the funniest riotous laughter at dinner involved stories of making the wrong innuendos in various languages, where it is revealed that Hen has a secret technique of petting women's hair, where a number of the dinner attendees consumed many bottles of dinner, and you end up going out for drinks afterwards...don't sit too close to anybody.

Granted Euge dropped his pants for our NY guest.  

But, the dropping of the pants was nothing like the gratuitous petting of hair as a few unnamed Yelpers tried to prove that they could improve on Hen's technique of hair-petting as a pick-up method (and sad to say, despite all the drunken practising of the aforementioned unnamed Yelpers, none improved on Hen's technique).  I hid behind Euge, of all people.

Fireside Bar: leather covered booths for those practising hair-petting techniques.  Regular chairs for those in hiding like me.

Plus, they made no fuss when, in the midst of drunken jostling, we broke a glass, nor when we took a drink outside...except to say: drink it up or come back in. 

Good neighborhood bar...and tolerant of a rowdy bunch.
author: Sooj O.

description: Super friendly staff, laid back atmosphere, a great place!
author: Eric B.

description:
Allow me to explain the one star here.. You see, I'm one of those people who doesn't like being treated like shit. I know, I know, it's terribly un-SF-cool to be a non-masochist, but I'm not cool like that. 

What do I mean when I say "treated like shit"?

The bar has less than ten people in it when I walk in, and although I'm standing right in front on him, money in hand, it takes the bartender five minutes to address me after finishing his lighthearted conversation with his friend who's not even drinking.

After I place my order, the bartender checks everyone else's drinks (I assume they are regulars) and makes + serves their drinks before mine.

After I'm given my drink, the bartender's other friend audibly farts and then yells out loud at me, "hey man, take that shit outside", and the bartender has a good laugh.

Well, that's when I leave my drink at the bar and head over to the other place. ANY other place.

You know, it's too bad. With a couple of turntables and a complete staff/patron makeover, this place could really be a nice lounge in the Inner Sunset.
author: Tal K.

description:
It's a bar!  You know, the place in the neighborhood that's around the corner that you can drink with your friends and be as loud as you want.  That's about it.  But that's all you need!

We stopped by here after dinner at Lime Tree.  While Euge L. was busy shedding his clothes for Julie K., I had a great conversation with Nobu K. where we talked about everything from culture shock, to what it's like to grow up in San Francisco, to modern Asian history.  Definitely good times.

And while Fireside Bar might not stand out to me for any one reason, it's essential to have a local watering hole.  And to that end, it gets the job done.  Footnote: I hate parking in the Inner Sunset.
author: Tony L.

description:
Great cozy bar WWD (within walking distance).  Good for a night-cap after eating a meal in the carbtastic inner sunset (indian+thai+mexican+chinese=ethnic carbocoma).  The warm atmosphere and fireplace provide a wonderful escape for a mellow drink with a friend when trying to escape the bitter wind that rips down Irving on pretty much any given night.  

I've also walked by when they are showing sporting events on the tvs. It gets a bit more crowded but never seems crazy.  I've been able to peek in to check the score a few times while wandering around.
author: James M.

description:
It's not a bad bar.  There's a fireplace, outlined in glass-encased neon, with a comfy half-circle of couches in front.  There's a lot of glass along the front.  There's an ordinary selection of beer on tap, and a reasonably good selection of booze.
Downsides:  too many seats packed into too small a space.  If you're adjacent to the fireplace, you nearly have to step over other people to get out to the bar & back.  Also, it's pretty much an echo chamber, so it gets loud.
author: Don H.

description:
This place helped make my night one of the funnest nights ever. It's all Steven's fault too! My boyfriend and him instantly hit it off and started trading drink recipes and before you know it our crew had more drinks than I can count! All the drinks were made to perfection and the service was what all bartenders should strive for. So thank you a million times for such a fun night. I can guarantee you we will become regulars! 

The bar itself is clean and cozy and sexy feeling. Great place to take a date I think. The pictures on the page don't do it justice, it's much sexier looking at night. And A+ for not being out of toilet paper at 1am. I love that the bathroom floors are painted black too, makes it feel much cleaner. As far as bar bathrooms go, it was one of the cleanest I've seen for being so late on a Saturday night. 

All in all a definite gem in the inner sunset. Fancy yet casual. Chances are you'll see me here quite often in weekends to come!

UPDATE: Dear Steven.. I love you. You got me wasted last night (again!) and I appreciate that. Your drinks are amazing and creative. If I had enough room in my apartment I'd make you live with me and then I'd be drunk and giggly everyday!

People... if you are feeling brave, ask Steven to 'surprise you'. The Mexican Standoff he makes is fantastic.
author: Ali R.

description:
Stop #2 on last night's Sunset Pub Crawl.

What the heck, I'll give this place a 5.  It is a close second to Little Shamrock as my favorite Sunset bar.  Admittedly, I am a huge sucker for fireplaces and that sort of cozy ambience.  There's a hint of velvety lounge feel while still being a low-key neighborhood bar at heart. 

Plus, the bartender obligingly made me a round of Dirty Mothers.  I guess the fireplace put me in Northwest Nostalgia mode.  Seriously, in Seattle and Vancouver Dirty Mothers are on the cocktail menu, and in California I have to tell the bartenders how to make them.  What gives?  PS, a Dirty Mother is a White Russian, s/vodka/brandy/  (yes, I just used a regex, feel free to laugh at me).  While I'm on the subject, pretty much any vodka drink is twice as good if you use brandy instead.  Try it sometime!
author: Wes M.

description:
More modern than I was expecting, but still 4 stars here thanks to cheap drinks, friendly staff, and cozy atmosphere.   I'd kill to have a place like this over in the Richmond.  

Didn't pick up on the digital DJ box.   Will have to bring my quarters next time.
author: John H.

description:
Being at Fireside Bar is like hanging out in your living room.  Except with people you don't know.  And beers on tap.  Really chill atmosphere and very cool neighborhood vibe, but not in a corny Cheers-Where-Everybody-Knows-Your-Name kind of way.  

The bartenders are really friendly and it's a great place to just meet up with friends and hang out.  It's nicer to go on the slower nights but I've been here on a Saturday and it's not overly-crowded/annoying.  

My bf and I came out to have a few drinks on a non-busy night and forgot that it was CASH ONLY and we had NO CASH.  Having ordered our drinks before realizing our gaffe, we explained the situation to our bartender and my bf had to leave me as hostage as he hauled ass to a bank.
